nodes.documentation:
@title GatewayComposer contract.
 * @notice GatewayComposer is a composition contract which can be used to
        optimise the UX flow of the user where the user intends to perform
        a single combined action.
nodes.name: GatewayComposer

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Only owner can call the function."

arguments.value: Only owner can call the function.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Only owner can call the function."

nodes.documentation: Checks that msg.sender is owner address.
nodes.name: onlyOwner

nodes.documentation:
Checks that mutex is acquired or not. If mutex is not acquired,
 mutexAcquired is set to true. At the end of function execution,
 mutexAcquired is set to false.
nodes.name: mutex

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ValueToken address is same as owner address."

arguments.value: ValueToken address is same as owner address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ValueToken address is same as owner address."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "BrandedToken address is same as owner address."

arguments.value: BrandedToken address is same as owner address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "BrandedToken address is same as owner address."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Contract constructor.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - owner address should not be zero
         - ValueToken address should not be zero
         - BrandedToken address should not be zero
         - ValueToken address should not be equal to owner address
         - BrandedToken address should not be equal to owner address
         - ValueToken address should be equal to BrandedToken.valueToken()
     * @param _owner Address of the staker on the value chain.
@param _valueToken EIP20Token which is staked.
@param _brandedToken It's a value backed minted EIP20Token.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Gateway address is same as owner address."

arguments.value: Gateway address is same as owner address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Gateway address is same as owner address."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfers value tokens from msg.sender to itself after staker
        approves GatewayComposer, approves BrandedToken for value tokens
        and calls BrandedToken.requestStake function.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - stakeVT can't be 0
         - mintBT amount and converted stakeVT amount should be equal
         - gateway address can't be zero
         - Gateway address should not be equal to owner address
         - beneficiary address can't be zero
         - successful execution of ValueToken transfer
         - successful execution of ValueToken approve
     *      stakeVT can't be 0 because gateway.stake also doesn't allow 0 stake
     amount. This condition also helps in validation of in progress
     stake requests. See acceptStakeRequest for details.
     *      mintBT is not stored in StakeRequest struct as there was
     significant gas cost difference between storage vs dynamic
     evaluation from BrandedToken convert function.
     * @param _stakeVT ValueToken amount which is staked.
@param _mintBT Amount of BrandedToken amount which will be minted.
@param _gateway Gateway contract address.
@param _beneficiary The address in the auxiliary chain where the utility
                    tokens will be minted.
@param _gasPrice Gas price that staker is ready to pay to get the stake
                 and mint process done.
@param _gasLimit Gas limit that staker is ready to pay.
@param _nonce Nonce of the staker address. It can be obtained from
              Gateway.getNonce() method.
     * @return stakeRequestHash_ Hash unique for each stake request.
nodes.name: requestStake

nodes.documentation:
@notice Approves Gateway for the minted BTs, calls Gateway.stake after
        BrandedToken.acceptStakeRequest execution is successful.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - stake request hash is valid
         - successful execution of ValueToken transferFrom
         - successful execution of ValueToken approve
         - BrandedToken.acceptStakeRequest execution is successful
         - successful execution of BrandedToken approve
     *      As per requirement bounty token currency is same as valueToken.
     Bounty flow:
         - facilitator approves GatewayComposer for base tokens as bounty
         - GatewayComposer approves Gateway for the bounty
     * @param _stakeRequestHash Unique hash for each stake request.
@param _r R of the signature.
@param _s S of the signature.
@param _v V of the signature.
@param _hashLock Hash lock provided by the facilitator.
     * @return messageHash_ Message hash unique for each stake request.
nodes.name: acceptStakeRequest

nodes.documentation:
@notice Revokes stake request by calling BrandedToken.revokeStakeRequest()
        and deleting information.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - stake request hash is valid
         - BrandedToken.revokeStakeRequest() should return true
         - ValueToken.transfer() should return true
     *      The method is called after calling requestStake. In this flow
     locked ValueToken is transferred to owner. Transfer is done for
     convenience. This way extra step of calling transferToken is
     avoided.
     * @param _stakeRequestHash Stake request hash.
     * @return success_ True on successful execution.
nodes.name: revokeStakeRequest
transferToken
approveToken

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "In progress stake requests are present."

arguments.value: In progress stake requests are present.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "In progress stake requests are present."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Remove storage & code from blockchain.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - ValueToken balance should be 0
         - BrandedToken balance should be 0
         - There should not be any in progress stake requests
     *      BrandedToken contract has mapping stakeRequestHashes which stores
     staker vs stakeRequestHash data. In progress stake requests are
     validated by doing lookup into the stakeRequestHashes mapping.
nodes.name: destroy

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Gateway address is same as owner address."

arguments.value: Gateway address is same as owner address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Gateway address is same as owner address."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfers value tokens to itself to pay the revert penalty,
        approves Gateway to transfer the value tokens for the penalty,
        and calls Gateway.revertStake.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - msg.sender is owner
         - Gateway address can't be zero
         - Gateway address should not be equal to owner address
         - successful execution of ValueToken transferFrom
         - successful execution of ValueToken approve
     *      As per requirement, penalty is paid in valueToken.
     Penalty flow:
         - staker approves GatewayComposer for value tokens as penalty
         - GatewayComposer approves Gateway for the penalty
     * @param _gateway Gateway contract address.
@param _penalty Amount to pay to revert stake.
@param _messageHash Message hash unique for each stake request.
     * @return success_ True on successful execution.
nodes.name: revertStake

nodes.documentation:
@notice Transfers value tokens from msg.sender to itself after staker
        approves GatewayComposer, approves BrandedToken for value tokens
        and calls BrandedToken.requestStake function.
     * @dev Function requires:
         - stakeVT can't be 0
         - mintBT amount and converted stakeVT amount should be equal
         - gateway address can't be zero
         - Gateway address should not be equal to owner address
         - beneficiary address can't be zero
         - successful execution of ValueToken transfer
         - successful execution of ValueToken approve
     *      stakeVT can't be 0 because gateway.stake also doesn't allow 0 stake
     amount. This condition also helps in validation of in progress
     stake requests. See acceptStakeRequest for details.
     *      mintBT is not stored in StakeRequest struct as there was
     significant gas cost difference between storage vs dynamic
     evaluation from BrandedToken convert function.
     * @param _stakeVT ValueToken amount which is staked.
@param _mintBT Amount of BrandedToken amount which will be minted.
@param _gateway Gateway contract address.
@param _beneficiary The address in the auxiliary chain where the utility
                    tokens will be minted.
@param _gasPrice Gas price that staker is ready to pay to get the stake
                 and mint process done.
@param _gasLimit Gas limit that staker is ready to pay.
@param _nonce Nonce of the staker address. It can be obtained from
              Gateway.getNonce() method.

@notice Approves Gateway for the minted BTs, calls Gateway.stake after

     * @dev Function requires:

     Bounty flow:
         - facilitator approves GatewayComposer for base tokens as bounty
         - GatewayComposer approves Gateway for the bounty

@param _r R of the signature.
@param _s S of the signature.

acceptStakeRequest(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.details: Function requires:         - stake request hash is valid         - successful execution of ValueToken transferFrom         - successful execution of ValueToken approve         - BrandedToken.acceptStakeRequest execution is successful         - successful execution of BrandedToken approve     *      As per requirement bounty token currency is same as valueToken.     Bounty flow:         - facilitator approves GatewayComposer for base tokens as bounty         - GatewayComposer approves Gateway for the bounty

params._hashLock: Hash lock provided by the facilitator.
params._stakeRequestHash: Unique hash for each stake request.

approveToken(address,address,uint256).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender should be owner         - EIP20 token address should not be zero         - token.approve() execution should be successful

params._spender: Address authorized to spend from the function caller's                address.
params._value: Amount up to which spender is authorized to spend.

constructor.details: Function requires:         - owner address should not be zero         - ValueToken address should not be zero         - BrandedToken address should not be zero         - ValueToken address should not be equal to owner address         - BrandedToken address should not be equal to owner address         - ValueToken address should be equal to BrandedToken.valueToken()

params._brandedToken: It's a value backed minted EIP20Token.
params._owner: Address of the staker on the value chain.

destroy().details: Function requires:         - ValueToken balance should be 0         - BrandedToken balance should be 0         - There should not be any in progress stake requests     *      BrandedToken contract has mapping stakeRequestHashes which stores     staker vs stakeRequestHash data. In progress stake requests are     validated by doing lookup into the stakeRequestHashes mapping.

requestStake(uint256,uint256,address,add.details: Function requires:         - stakeVT can't be 0         - mintBT amount and converted stakeVT amount should be equal         - gateway address can't be zero         - Gateway address should not be equal to owner address         - beneficiary address can't be zero         - successful execution of ValueToken transfer         - successful execution of ValueToken approve     *      stakeVT can't be 0 because gateway.stake also doesn't allow 0 stake     amount. This condition also helps in validation of in progress     stake requests. See acceptStakeRequest for details.     *      mintBT is not stored in StakeRequest struct as there was     significant gas cost difference between storage vs dynamic     evaluation from BrandedToken convert function.

params._beneficiary: The address in the auxiliary chain where the utility                    tokens will be minted.
params._gasLimit: Gas limit that staker is ready to pay.
params._gasPrice: Gas price that staker is ready to pay to get the stake                 and mint process done.
params._mintBT: Amount of BrandedToken amount which will be minted.
params._nonce: Nonce of the staker address. It can be obtained from              Gateway.getNonce() method.

requestStake(uint256,uint256,address,add.return: stakeRequestHash_ Hash unique for each stake request.

revertStake(address,uint256,bytes32).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender is owner         - Gateway address can't be zero         - Gateway address should not be equal to owner address         - successful execution of ValueToken transferFrom         - successful execution of ValueToken approve     *      As per requirement, penalty is paid in valueToken.     Penalty flow:         - staker approves GatewayComposer for value tokens as penalty         - GatewayComposer approves Gateway for the penalty

params._messageHash: Message hash unique for each stake request.
params._penalty: Amount to pay to revert stake.

revokeStakeRequest(bytes32).details: Function requires:         - stake request hash is valid         - BrandedToken.revokeStakeRequest() should return true         - ValueToken.transfer() should return true     *      The method is called after calling requestStake. In this flow     locked ValueToken is transferred to owner. Transfer is done for     convenience. This way extra step of calling transferToken is     avoided.

transferToken(address,address,uint256).details: Function requires:         - msg.sender should be owner         - EIP20 token address should not be zero         - token.transfer() execution should be successful

params._to: Address to which tokens are transferred.
params._value: Amount of tokens to be transferred.

acceptStakeRequest(bytes32,bytes32,bytes.notice: Approves Gateway for the minted BTs, calls Gateway.stake after        BrandedToken.acceptStakeRequest execution is successful.

approveToken(address,address,uint256).notice: Approves EIP20 token to spender address.

requestStake(uint256,uint256,address,add.notice: Transfers value tokens from msg.sender to itself after staker        approves GatewayComposer, approves BrandedToken for value tokens        and calls BrandedToken.requestStake function.

revertStake(address,uint256,bytes32).notice: Transfers value tokens to itself to pay the revert penalty,        approves Gateway to transfer the value tokens for the penalty,        and calls Gateway.revertStake.

revokeStakeRequest(bytes32).notice: Revokes stake request by calling BrandedToken.revokeStakeRequest()        and deleting information.

transferToken(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfers EIP20 token to destination address.

userdoc.notice: GatewayComposer is a composition contract which can be used to        optimise the UX flow of the user where the user intends to perform        a single combined action.
